## Description {#details}

Locate join blocks for disjoint paths starting at a divergent branch.

An analysis per divergent branch that returns the set of basic blocks whose phi nodes become divergent due to divergent control. These are the blocks that are reachable by two disjoint paths from the branch, or cycle exits reachable along a path that is disjoint from a path to the cycle latch.

Definition at line 259 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/genericuniformityimpl-h">GenericUniformityImpl.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Functions

### getJoinBlocks() {#ab8d94c28ff25155aabaffd9dfa97ba76}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename ContextT&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>auto llvm::GenericSyncDependenceAnalysis&lt; ContextT &gt;::getJoinBlocks (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="#a8df60404d3855e26334f8812566c173a">BlockT</a> &#42; DivTermBlock)</>}>
Computes divergent join points and cycle exits caused by branch divergence in <code>Term</code>.

This returns a pair of sets:
<ul>
<li>The set of blocks which are reachable by disjoint paths from <code>Term</code>.</li>
<li>The set also contains cycle exits if there two disjoint paths: one from <code>Term</code> to the cycle exit and another from <code>Term</code> to the cycle header.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/genericuniformityimpl-h/#l00307">307</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/genericuniformityimpl-h">GenericUniformityImpl.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
